page.title: 18Farming(continued)
page.content: Knowle Bank Farm is owned by the Maydews.It has 86 acres and is mostly dairy. The farm is very old and the family has lived there for 120 yrs.They own 4 tractors, a harvestor, haymaking machinery, rollers and a plough.In winter the cows stay in big sheds and are fed on silage. In the summer the cows eat the grass in the fields and produce lots of milk.One cow can give about 16 litres per day.The herd gives about 1000 litres per day. Park House Farm is mainly a dairy farm and grows a few potatoes.The farm employs 2 workers on the 126 acres with 80 cows.Cows yield most milk in May & June.After milking, the milk is stored in stainless steel tanks until it is collected by the local dairy for bottling.
